points.description: Number of loyalty card points changed by the event.

type.description: Type of the source triggering the event.

Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer entered a higher loyalty tier.

CustomerWithSummaryLoyaltyReferrals.title: Customer With Summary Loyalty Referrals
CustomerWithSummaryLoyaltyReferrals.description: Customer details with details about loyalty and referral programs.

id.description: The ID of an existing customer that will be linked to the redemption in this request.

source_id.description: A unique identifier of the customer who validates a voucher.

system_metadata.description: Object used to store system metadata information.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer was created in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer was updated in the ISO 8601 format.

assets.description: Contains information about the customer's cockpit.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the redeeming customer.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the redemption was created in the ISO 8601 format.

amount.description:
For gift cards, this is a positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the number of redeemed credits.
For loyalty cards, this is the number of loyalty points used in the transaction.
In the case of redemption rollback, the numbers are expressed as negative integers.

voucher.description: Defines the details of the voucher being redeemed.

redemption.description: Unique redemption ID of the parent redemption.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes in the form of key/value pairs assigned to the redemption.

failure_code.description: If the result is `FAILURE`, this parameter will provide a generic reason as to why the redemption failed.

failure_message.description: If the result is `FAILURE`, this parameter will provide an expanded reason as to why the redemption failed.

reason.description: The reason for the redemption rollback.

channel.description: Defines the details of the channel through which the redemption was issued.

channel_id.description: Unique channel ID of the user performing the redemption. This is either a user ID from a user using the Voucherify Dashboard, an X-APP-Id of a user using the API, or the reward assignment ID for automatic reward redemption.

channel_type.description:
The source of the channel for the redemption:
`USER` - the redemption was made in the Voucherify Dashboard by a user,
 `API` - redemption was made through the API,
`AUTO_REDEEM - the redemption was made for a reward and it was made automatically.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the `redemption`.

id.description: Unique identifier of an existing customer. It is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique identifier of the customer. It can be a customer ID or email from a CRM system, database, or a third-party service.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that are attached to the customer. It stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the voucher assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Type of the voucher.

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code; `true` for campaign type `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

holder_id.description: Unique customer identifier of the redeemable holder. It equals to the customer ID assigned by Voucherify.

referrer_id.description: Unique identifier of the referrer assigned by Voucherify.

category_id.description: Unique identifier of the category that this voucher belongs to.

active.description: Shows whether the voucher is on or off. `true` indicates an *active* voucher and `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

redemption.description: Defines the redemption limits on vouchers.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

redeemed_quantity.description: How many times a voucher has already been redeemed.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the code starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the code expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the voucher.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

id.description: Campaign ID.

type.description:
Defines whether the campaign can be updated with new vouchers after campaign creation or if the campaign consists of standalone vouchers.

- `AUTO_UPDATE`: the campaign is dynamic, i.e. vouchers will generate based on set criteria
-  `STATIC`: vouchers need to be manually published
- `STANDALONE`: campaign for single vouchers

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code; `true` for campaign type `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

auto_join.description: Indicates whether customers will be able to auto-join the campaign if any earning rule is fulfilled.

join_once.description: If this value is set to `true`, customers will be able to join the campaign only once. It is always `false` for standalone voucher campaigns and it cannot be changed in them. It is always `true` for loyalty campaigns.

active.description: Indicates whether the campaign is active.

category_id.description: The unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a campaign. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the campaign.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is inactive *before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is inactive *after* this date.

description.description: An optional field to keep extra textual information about the campaign such as a campaign description and details.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign was updated in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the campaign.

RedemptionInternal.description: Redemption data used for internal communication

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the redemption.

channel_type.description: The source of the channel for the redemption rollback. A `USER` corresponds to the Voucherify Dashboard and an `API` corresponds to the API.

channel_id.description: Unique channel ID of the user performing the redemption. This is either a user ID from a user using the Voucherify Dashboard or an X-APP-Id of a user using the API.

failure_code.description: If the result is `FAILURE`, this parameter will provide a generic reason as to why the redemption failed.

failure_message.description: If the result is `FAILURE`, this parameter will provide an expanded reason as to why the redemption failed.

amount.description:
For gift cards, this is a positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the number of redeemed credits.
For loyalty cards, this is the number of loyalty points used in the transaction.
In the case of redemption rollback, the numbers are expressed as negative integers.

reason.description: System generated cause for the redemption being invalid in the context of the provided parameters.

items.title: Redemption Internal Related Redemptions Rollbacks Item

id.description: Unique rollback redemption ID.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created in the ISO 8601 format.

related_object_parent_id.description: Unique related parent object ID assigned by Voucherify, i.e. v_lfZi4rcEGe0sN9gmnj40bzwK2FH6QUno for a voucher.

voucher.description: Defines the details of the voucher being redeemed.

promotion_tier.description: Contains details of the promotion tier and the parent campaign.

assignment_id.description: Unique reward assignment ID assigned by Voucherify.

loyalty_tier_id.description: Unique loyalty tier ID assigned by Voucherify.

id.description: Unique reward ID, assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the reward.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the reward was created in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the reward was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

parameters.description: Defines how the reward is generated.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a reward. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the reward.

banner.description: Text displayed to customers on the website.

id.description: Unique identifier of the segment.
Unique identifier of the custome event.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the loyalty tier. A set of key/value pairs that can be attached to a loyalty tier object.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the loyalty tier was created in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the loyalty tier was updated in the ISO 8601 format.

config.description: Defines loyalty tier range in points.

points.description: Defines range of loyalty tier in points.

Shows whether the earning rule is turned on or off. `true` indicates an active earning rule

VoucherBalance.title: Voucher Balance
VoucherBalance.description: Contains information on how the balance was affected by the transaction.

type.description: The type of voucher whose balance is being adjusted due to the transaction.

total.description: The number of all points or credits accumulated on the card as affected by add or subtract operations.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON.

amount.description: Credits added or subtracted on a gift card.

points.description: Points added or subtracted in the transaction of a loyalty card.

balance.description: The available points or credits on the card after the transaction as affected by redemption or rollback.

operation_type.description: The type of the operation being performed. The operation type is `AUTOMATIC` if it is an automatic redemption.

related_object.description: Defines the resource that is being modified with the values that are returned in the balance object.

id.description: Identifies the voucher that is being modified. The ID is assigned by the Voucherify API.

type.description: The object being modified, i.e. voucher.

id.description: Unique identifier assigned by Voucherify that will be linked to the this event.

type.description: Type of the triggering event.

entity_id.description: ID of the entity that initiated the event.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the event was created in the ISO 8601 format.

group_id.description: Unique identifier of the request that triggered the event.

RewardRedemption.description: Details about the redemption of a reward

id.description: Unique identifier of the reward redemption.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the reward redemption was created in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the reward redemption was last updated in the ISO 8601 format.

campaign_id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign to which the redeemed reward belongs.

customer_id.description: Unique identifier of the customer redeeming the reward.

reward_assignment_id.description: Unique identifier of the reward assignment.

source_id.description: Unique identifier of the source which triggered the event.

source_type.description: Defines the source type of the reward redemption.

RewardAssignment.description: Details about the assignment of the reward to the customer.

id.description: Unique reward assignment ID, assigned by Voucherify.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the reward assignment was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the reward assignment was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the reward assignment.

related_object_id.description: Related object ID to which the reward was assigned.

related_object_type.description: Related object type to which the reward was assigned.

parameters.description: Defines the cost of the reward

loyalty.description: Defines the equivalent points value of the reward.

points.description: The number of points required to redeem the reward.

id.description: Unique identifier of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

source_id.description: Unique source identifier of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

customer_id.description: Unique customer identifier of the customer making the purchase. The ID is assigned by Voucherify.

referrer_id.description: Unique identifier of the referrer assigned by Voucherify.

amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

applied_discount_amount.description: This field shows the order-level discount applied. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

items_discount_amount.description: Sum of all product-specific discounts applied to the order.  It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

items_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).  
`sum(items, i => i.applied_discount_amount)`

total_discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

total_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).
`total_applied_discount_amount` = `applied_discount_amount` + `items_applied_discount_amount`

total_amount.description: Order amount after undoing all the discounts through the rollback redemption. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

items.description: Array of items applied to the order. It can include up to 500 items.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to an order. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format. It can be used to define business validation rules or discount formulas.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

id.description: Unique identifier of the transaction.

source_id.description: The merchant's product ID (if it is different than Voucherify's product ID).

campaign_id.description: Unqiue identifier of the voucher's parent campaign if it is part of campaign that generates bulk codes.

source.description: The channel through which the transaction took place, whether through the API, Dashboard, or integrated tool. In case of a redemption, this value is null.

reason.description: Reason why the transaction occurred. In case of a redemption, this value is null.

type.description: Type of transaction.

details.description: Contains the detailed information about the transaction.

order.description: Contains information about the original order.

id.description: Unique identifier of the order.

source_id.description: Unique identifier of the merchant's order if it is different from the Voucherify order ID.

event.description: Contains information about the event that triggers the point accrual.

id.description: Unique event ID.

type.description: Type of event.

earning_rule.description: Contains information about the earning rule.

id.description: Unique identifier of an earning rule, assigned by Voucherify.

source.description: Contains the custom earning rule name.

banner.description: Name of the earning rule. This is displayed as a header for the earning rule in the Dashboard.

id.description: Unique identifier of the segment.

loyalty_tier.description: Contains information about the loyalty tier that is mapped for the earning rule and used in the transaction.

id.description: Unique identifier of the loyalty tier, assigned by Voucherify.

name.description: User-defined name of the loyalty tier.

redemption.description: Contains information about the original redemption.

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

rollback.description: Contains information about the redemption rollback.

id.description: Unique identifier of the redemption rollback.

custom_event.description: Contains information about the custom event that triggers the point accrual.

id.description: Unique identifier of the event.

type.description: Type of the custom event.

event_schema.description: Contains information about the custom event metadata schema.

id.description: Unique identifier of the metadata schema.

holder_loyalty_tier.description: Loyalty tier of the loyalty card holder at the moment when the transaction occurred. The loyalty tier is the tier in which the holder was before the loyalty point balance changed.

id.description: Unique identifier of the loyalty tier, assigned by Voucherify.

name.description: User-defined name of the loyalty tier.

reward.description: Contains information about the pay with points reward.

id.description: Unique reward ID.

source_voucher.description: Contains information on how the balance on the donor loyalty card was affected by the transaction.

destination_voucher.description: Contains information on how the balance on the receiving loyalty card was affected by the transaction.

related_transaction_id.description: The related identifier of the transaction on the receiving card.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the transaction was created in ISO 8601 format.

LoyaltyPendingPoints.description: Contains details about the pending point entry.

id.description: Unique identifier of the pending point entry, assigned by Voucherify.

voucher_id.description: Unique identifier of the loyalty card, assigned by Voucherify.

campaign_id.description: Unique campaign identifier, assigned by Voucherify.

customer_id.description: Unique customer identifier, assigned by Voucherify.

order_id.description: Unique order identifier, assigned by Voucherify.

points.description: Number of points in the pending state.

activates_at.description: Date when the pending points are activated and added to the customer's loyalty card.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the pending point entry was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the pending point entry was modified. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

points.description: The incremental points removed or added to the current balance on the loyalty card.

total.description: The total of points accrued over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

type.description: The type of voucher being modified.

LoyaltyPointsBucket.description: Contains the details about expiring loyalty points.

campaign_id.description: Unique identifier of the parent campaign.

bucket.description: Defines the number of points stored in this loyalty point bucket.

VouchersBalanceUpdateResponseBody.description: Voucher balance data for gift vouchers
VouchersBalanceUpdateResponseBody.title: Voucher Balance Data

amount.description: The incremental amount added (positive integer) or subtracted (negative integer) to the current balance on the gift voucher. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

total.description: Total income incurred over the lifespan of the gift voucher.

balance.description: The balance after adding or subtracting a specified amount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

type.description: The type of voucher being modified.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. Default is `balance`.

related_object.description: Defines the resource that is being modified with the values that are returned in the balance object.

type.description: The object being modified, i.e. `voucher`.

id.description: The uniqe identifier that was assigned by Voucherify.

campaign.description: Details about the campaign related to the distribution with a promotion or send voucher purpose.

voucher.description: Details about the voucher related to the distribution with a send voucher purpose.

publication.description: Details about the publication related to the distribution with a send voucher purpose.

promotion_tier.description: Details about the promotion tier related to the distribution with a promotion purpose.

SimpleRedeemableHolder.title: Redeemable Holder
SimpleRedeemableHolder.description: Details about the holder of the redeemable.

id.description: Unique identifier of the redeemable holder.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the redeemable was assigned. Timestamp is presented in the ISO 8601 format.

campaign_type.description: Defines the type of the campaign.

voucher_type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

description.description: An arbitrary string that you can attach to a customer object.

phone.description: Customer's phone number. This parameter is mandatory for sending out codes to customers via an SMS channel.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer.

points.description: Customer's loyalty points.

referred_customers.description: Total number of customers referred by the customer.

campaigns.description: Contains campaigns with details about point balances and how many customers were referred by the customer.

additionalProperties.description: Contains details about the point balances left on loyalty cards and the number of referred customers in each campaign.

points.description: Remaining point balance in campaign.

loyalty_tier.description: Customer's loyalty tier within the campaign.

referred_customers.description: Number of customers referred by the customer in the campaign.

CustomerReferrals.title: Customer Referrals
CustomerReferrals.description: Summary of customer's referrals, in this case, the customer being the referee, i.e. information about the source of referrals and number of times the customer was referred by other customers.

total.description: Total number of times this customer received a referral, i.e. was referred by another customer.

campaigns.description: Contains an array of campaigns that served as the source of a referral for the customer.

items.title: Customer Referrals Campaigns Item
items.description: Contains information about the source of the referral.

campaign_id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign assigned by Voucherify.

referrer_id.description: Unique referrer ID assigned by Voucherify. This is the customer ID of a customer that is referring this customer.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer was referred in the ISO 8601 format.

id.description: Unique promotion tier ID.

banner.description: Text to be displayed to your customers on your website.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a promotion tier. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the promotion tier.

id.description: Unique identifier of the promotion stack.

category_id.description: Unique identifier of the category of the promotion stack.

campaign.description: Represents simplified promotion stack campaign data.

id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign.

ids.description: Contains the list of tiers in a pre-defined sequence.

Gift.title: Gift
Gift.description: Contains current gift card balance information.

amount.description: Total gift card income over the lifetime of the card. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $10 amount is written as 1000.

balance.description: Available funds. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $10 amount is written as 1000.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order.

points.description: Total number of points added to the loyalty card over its lifespan.

balance.description: Points available for reward redemption. This is calculated as follows: `balance` = `points` - `expired_points` - `subtracted_points` - `redemption.redeemed_points`.

next_expiration_date.description: The next closest date when the next set of points are due to expire.

next_expiration_points.description: The amount of points that are set to expire next.

pending_points.description: Shows the number of pending points that will be added to the loyalty card when they are activated automatically or manually.

expired_points.description: Shows the total number of expired points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

subtracted_points.description: Shows the total number of subtracted points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the category was created in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the category was updated in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the category.

stacking_rules_type.description: The type of the stacking rule eligibility.

type.description: Type of the voucher.

discount.description: Defines the voucher discount type and details. It will not be returned at all or it will return a `null` for `LOYALTY_CARD`.

gift.description: Defines the voucher gift details. It will not be returned at all or it will return a `null` for `LOYALTY_CARD`.

loyalty_card.description: Defines the voucher loyalty card details.  It will not be returned at all or it will return a `null` for `DISCOUNT_VOUCHER` or `GIFT_CARD`.

redemption.description: Defines the redemption limits on vouchers.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

redeemed_quantity.description: How many times a voucher has already been redeemed.

ReferralProgram.title: Referral Program
ReferralProgram.description: Defines the referee reward and the way a referral is triggered. Context: `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

conversion_event_type.description: Defines how a referral is triggered.

custom_event.description: Contains details about the custom event.

id.description: Unique custom event ID.

related_object_parent.description: Details of the resource from which the reward originates.

id.description: Unique identifier of the reward source.

object.description: Type of resource represented by the source of the reward.

type.description: Type of reward.

amount.description: Define the number of `points` to add to a loyalty card or `credits` to the balance on a gift card. In case of the gift card, the value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

assignment_id.description: Unique reward assignment ID assigned by Voucherify.

loyalty_tier_id.description: Unique loyalty tier ID assigned by Voucherify.

id.description: Unique reward ID.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the redemption was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp in ISO 8601 format indicating when the reward was updated.

parameters.description: Defines how the reward is generated.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a reward. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the reward.

type.description: Reward type.

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher.

code.description: A code that identifies a voucher. Pattern can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters.

campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

campaign_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

category_id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

gift.description: Object representing gift parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `GIFT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`.

amount.description: Total gift card income over the lifetime of the card. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

balance.description: Available funds. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order.

loyalty_card.description: Object representing loyalty card parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `LOYALTY_CARD`. Defaults to `null`.

points.description: Total number of points added to the loyalty card over its lifespan.

balance.description: Points available for reward redemption. This is calculated as follows: `balance` = `points` - `expired_points` - `subtracted_points` - `redemption.redeemed_points`.

next_expiration_date.description: The next closest date when the next set of points are due to expire.

next_expiration_points.description: The amount of points that are set to expire next.

pending_points.description: Shows the number of pending points that will be added to the loyalty card when they are activated automatically or manually.

expired_points.description: Shows the total number of expired points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

subtracted_points.description: Shows the total number of subtracted points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the code starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the code expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the voucher is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day. `start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a voucher with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the voucher will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, a voucher with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the voucher is valid.

- `0` Sunday
- `1` Monday
- `2` Tuesday
- `3` Wednesday
- `4` Thursday
- `5` Friday
- `6` Saturday

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code; `true` for campaign type `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was created in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

holder_id.description: Unique customer ID of voucher owner.

referrer_id.description: Unique identifier of the referrer assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. Default is `voucher`.

publish.description: This object stores a summary of publish events: an events counter and an endpoint which can be called to return details of each event.  A publication is required for loyalty cards and referral codes. This object gets updated whenever a voucher has been published. Publication means assigning a code to a particular customer.

object.description: The type of the object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the `url` attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of publications can be accessed using a GET method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/publications`

redemption.description: Stores a summary of redemptions that have been applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

redeemed_quantity.description: How many times a voucher has already been redeemed.

redeemed_amount.description: Total amount redeemed. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 balance is written as 10000.

object.description: The type of the object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the url attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of redemptions can be accessed using a GET method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/redemptions`

PromotionTier.description: Object representing a promotion tier. Promotion tiers are always assigned to a campaign and cannot be used standalone.
PromotionTier.title: Promotion Tier

id.description: Unique promotion tier ID.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the promotion tier was created in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the promotion tier was updated in the ISO 8601 format.

banner.description: Text to be displayed to your customers on your website.

action.description: Contains details about the discount applied by the promotion tier.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the promotion tier. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a promotion tier object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the promotion tier in a structured format.

hierarchy.description: The promotions hierarchy defines the order in which the discounts from different tiers will be applied to a customer's order. If a customer qualifies for discounts from more than one tier, discounts will be applied in the order defined in the hierarchy.

campaign.description: Contains details about promotion tier's parent campaign.

id.description: Unique campaign ID.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in the ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in the ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Recurrent time periods when the campaign is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in the ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a campaign with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in the ISO 8601 format. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P1D` will be valid for a duration of one day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the campaign is valid.

- `0` Sunday
- `1` Monday
- `2` Tuesday
- `3` Wednesday
- `4` Thursday
- `5` Friday
- `6` Saturday

active.description:
A flag indicating whether the campaign is active or not active. A campaign can be disabled even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date` using the [Disable Campaign](ref:disable-campaign) endpoint.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the campaign object. This object stores information about the campaign.

campaign_id.description: Promotion tier's parent campaign's unique ID.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the promotion tier on or off. You can disable a promotion tier even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* promotion tier
- `false` indicates an *inactive* promotion tier

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier starts to be active in the ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier expires in the ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive after* this date.

validity_timeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the promotion tier is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day. `start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in the ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, a promotion tier with an `interval` of `P2D` will be active every other day.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time the promotion tier will be active in the ISO 8601 format. For example, a promotion tier with a `duration` of `P1D` will be valid for a duration of one day.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the promotion tier is valid.

- `0` Sunday
- `1` Monday
- `2` Tuesday
- `3` Wednesday
- `4` Thursday
- `5` Friday
- `6` Saturday

summary.description: Contains statistics about promotion tier redemptions and orders.

redemptions.description: Contains statistics about promotion tier redemptions.

total_redeemed.description: Number of times the promotion tier was redeemed.

orders.description: Contains statistics about orders related to the promotion tier.

total_discount_amount.description: Sum of total discount applied using the promotion tier.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the promotion tier.

id.description: Unique product ID.
Unique SKU ID.

4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN.title: Campaign
4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN.description: These are parameters representing a Campaign reward. These can be in the form of discount coupons, gift card credits, or loyalty point credits.

campaign.description: Objects stores information about the campaign related to the reward.

4_obj_reward_object_parameters_COIN.title: Pay with Points
4_obj_reward_object_parameters_COIN.description: These are parameters representing a Pay with Points (COIN) reward.

coin.description: Defines the ratio by mapping the number of loyalty points in `points_ratio` to a predefined cash amount in `exchange_ratio`.

exchange_ratio.description: The cash equivalent of the points defined in the `points_ratio` property.

points_ratio.description: The number of loyalty points that will map to the predefined cash amount defined by the `exchange_ratio` property.

4_obj_reward_object_parameters_MATERIAL.title: Material
4_obj_reward_object_parameters_MATERIAL.description: These are parameters representing products as a reward.

product.description: Contains information about the product given as a reward.

id.description: Unique identifier of the product assigned by Voucherify.

sku_id.description: Unique identifier of the SKU assigned by Voucherify for the SKU given as a reward.

SimpleCustomerRequiredObjectType.description: Simplified customer data with limited properties used in Event Tracking endpoints.
SimpleCustomerRequiredObjectType.title: Event Tracking Customer Object

id.description: Unique identifier of a customer. It is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique identifier of the customer. It can be a customer ID or email from a CRM system, database, or a third-party service.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the customer.

earning_rules.description: Contains a list of earning rule IDs and their points mapping for the given earning rule.

rewards.description: Contains a list of reward IDs and their points mapping for the given reward.

points.description: Defines range of loyalty tier in points.

customer_id.description: Unique customer identifier of the customer making the purchase. The ID is assigned by Voucherify.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the loyalty tier starts to be active in the ISO 8601 format. Loyalty tier is inactive before this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the loyalty tier expires in the ISO 8601 format. Loyalty tier is inactive after this date.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the loyalty tier was created in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the loyalty tier was updated in the ISO 8601 format.

id.description: Unique earning rule identifier assigned by Voucherify.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the earning rule was created in the ISO 8601 format.

event.description: Defines the event which triggers the earning rule to add points to a loyalty card.

segment.description: Contains the id of a customer segment. Required for the customer.segment.entered option in event.

id.description: Unique identifier of a customer segment assigned by Voucherify.

loyalty_tier.description: Defines the tier associated with the earning rule definition.

id.description:
Unique loyalty tier ID associated with the earning rule.    

- `__ANY__`: any loyalty tier within the campaign

pending_points.description: Defines the configuration for pending points. Pending points can be used only with the `order.paid` event.

period_type.description: Defines the type of the period during which the points are in the pending state. Currently, only `DAY` value is accepted.

period_value.description: Defines for how long the points are in the pending state. The minimum value is 1, maximum is 90.

source.description: Contains the custom earning rule name and parent campaign.

banner.description: Name of the earning rule. This is displayed as a header for the earning rule in the Dashboard.

object_id.description: A unique campaign identifier assigned by Voucherify.

object_type.description: Defines the object associated with the earning rule. Defaults to `campaign`.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. Default is `earning_rule`.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the earning rule starts to be active in the ISO 8601 format.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the earning rule expires. Expiration timestamp in the ISO 8601 format.

validity_timeframe.description: Sets recurrent time periods when the earning rule is valid.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time an earning rule will be active in the ISO 8601 format.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in the ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration.

validity_day_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the earning rule is valid.

- `0` Sunday
- `1` Monday
- `2` Tuesday
- `3` Wednesday
- `4` Thursday
- `5` Friday
- `6` Saturday

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the earning rule. A set of key/value pairs that is attached to an earning rule object.

id.description: Unique identifier assigned by Voucherify of an existing order that is linked to the redemption of this request.

source_id.description: Unique source ID of an existing order that is linked to the redemption of this request.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was last updated in the ISO 8601 format.

amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

initial_amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order.

items_discount_amount.description: Sum of all product-specific discounts applied to the order.

total_discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied to the order.

total_amount.description: Order amount after undoing all the discounts through the rollback redemption.

applied_discount_amount.description: This field shows the order-level discount applied.

items_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request.  
`sum(items, i => i.applied_discount_amount)`

total_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request.  
`total_applied_discount_amount` = `applied_discount_amount` + `items_applied_discount_amount`

items.description: Array of items applied to the order.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to an order. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format.

customer_id.description: Unique customer identifier of the customer making the purchase. The ID is assigned by Voucherify.

referrer_id.description: Unique identifier of the referrer assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

id.description: A unique identifier of an existing customer.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

id.description: Unique identifier of the publication assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the `publication`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the publication was created in the ISO 8601 format.

customer_id.description: Unique identifier of the customer receiving the publication.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the publication.

source_type.description: Defines the type of the distribution source.

source_id.description: Unique identifier of the distribution source.
Unique identifier of the merchant's publication if it is different from the Voucherify publication ID.

vouchers_id.description: Contains the unique internal voucher ID that was assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `order_item`.

source_id.description: The merchants product/SKU ID (if it is different from the Voucherify product/SKU ID).

related_object.description: Used along with the source_id property. It can be set to either SKU or product.

product_id.description: A unique product ID assigned by Voucherify.

sku_id.description: A unique SKU ID assigned by Voucherify.

quantity.description: The quantity of the particular item in the cart.

amount.description: The total amount of the order item (price * quantity).

discount_amount.description: The sum of all order-item-level discounts applied to the order.

price.description: Unit price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000.

subtotal_amount.description: Final order amount after the applied discount.

LoyaltyPendingPointsDetails.title: Pending Point Details
LoyaltyPendingPointsDetails.description: Details about how the pending points were earned.

loyalty_tier.description: The loyalty tier that is mapped for the earning rule and used in the pending point transaction.

id.description: Unique identifier of the loyalty tier, assigned by Voucherify.

name.description: User-defined name of the loyalty tier.

holder_loyalty_tier.description: Loyalty tier of the loyalty card holder at the moment when the transaction occurred. The loyalty tier is the tier in which the holder was at the moment pending points were created.

id.description: Unique identifier of the loyalty tier, assigned by Voucherify.

name.description: User-defined name of the loyalty tier.

event.description: Details about the event that created pending points.

id.description: Unique event identifier, assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Type of the event that triggered the creation of pending points.

group_id.description: Unique identifier of the request that triggered the event, assigned by Voucherify.

entity_id.description: Unique identifier of the entity that triggered the event, assigned by Voucherify. For pending points, it is the `customer_id` of the customer who paid for the order.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the event occurred. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

earning_rule.description: Contains information about the earning rule.

id.description: Unique identifier of an earning rule, assigned by Voucherify.

source.description: Contains the custom earning rule name.

banner.description: Name of the earning rule. This is displayed as a header for the earning rule in the Dashboard.

order.description: Details about the order that caused adding pending points.

id.description: Unique order identifier, assigned by Voucherify.
Unique identifier of the custom event.

total_redeemed.description: Total number of the redemptions made by the customer.

total_failed.description: Total number of the redemptions that failed.

total_succeeded.description: Total number of the redemptions that succeeded.

total_rolled_back.description: Total number of the redemptions that were rolled back for the customer.

total_rollback_failed.description: Total number of the redemption rollbacks that failed.

total_rollback_succeeded.description: Total number of the redemption rollbacks that succeeded.

redeemed_amount.description: Total amount of gift card credits redeemed by the customer. The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `1000 cents` for `$10.00`.

amount_to_go.description: Remaining gift card balance across all gift cards. The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `1000 cents` for `$10.00`.

redeemed_points.description: Total number of the loyalty points redeemed by the customer.

points_to_go.description: Sum of the remaining available point balance across all loyalty cards.

total_amount.description: The total amount spent by the customer. The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `1000 cents` for `$10.00`.

total_count.description: Total number of orders made by the customer.

average_amount.description: Average amount spent on orders. `total_amount` ÷ `total_count`. The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `1000 cents` for `$10.00`.

last_order_amount.description: Amount spent on last order. The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `1000 cents` for `$10.00`.

last_order_date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time of the customer's last order in the ISO 8601 format.

id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

amount_off.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

type.description: Discount type.

unit_off.description: Number of units granted a full value discount.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product inventory (e.g. time, items).

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

type.description: Discount type.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

percent_off.description: The percent discount that the customer will receive.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

fixed_amount.description: Sets a fixed value for an order total or the item price. The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000. If the fixed amount is calculated by the formula, i.e. the `fixed_amount_formula` parameter is present in the fixed amount definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. As a result, if the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed value.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

CampaignLoyaltyCard.title: Campaign Loyalty Card
CampaignLoyaltyCard.description: Schema model for a campaign loyalty card.

points.description: The initial number of points to assign to the loyalty card. This is the current loyalty card score i.e. the number of loyalty points on the card.

expiration_rules.description: Defines the loyalty point expiration rule. This expiration rule applies when there are no `expiration_rules` defined for an earning rule.

period_type.description: Type of period. Can be set for `MONTH` or `FIXED_DAY_OF_YEAR`. `MONTH` requires the `period_value` field. `FIXED_DAY_OF_YEAR` requires the `fixed_month` and `fixed_day` fields.

period_value.description: Value of the period. Required for the `period_type: MONTH`.

rounding_type.description: Type of rounding of the expiration period. Optional  for the `period_type: MONTH`.

rounding_value.description: Value of rounding of the expiration period. Required for the `rounding_type`.

fixed_month.description: Determines the month when the points expire; `1` is January, `2` is February, and so on. Required for the `period_type: FIXED_DAY_OF_YEAR`.

fixed_day.description: Determines the day of the month when the points expire. Required for the `period_type: FIXED_DAY_OF_YEAR`.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique SKU identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price. It is represented by a value multiplied by 100 to accurately reflect 2 decimal places, such as `$100.00` being expressed as `10000`.

attributes.description: The attributes object stores values for all custom attributes inherited by the SKU from the parent product. A set of key/value pairs that are attached to a SKU object and are unique to each SKU within a product family.

image_url.description: The HTTPS URL pointing to the .png or .jpg file that will be used to render the SKU image.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the SKU. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a SKU object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the SKU in a structured format.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the SKU was created in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the SKU was updated in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `SKU`.

ValidityHours.title: Validity Hours
ValidityHours.description: Allows to create Happy Hours scenario.

daily.description: Defines the reccuring period/s of time when the happy hour promotion will be active.

items.title: Daily
items.description: Defines the reccuring period/s of time when the happy hour promotion will be active.

start_time.description: Defines the starting hour for the happy hours promotion in HH:mm format. Happy hours are *inactive before* this time.

days_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the campaign is valid.

- `0`  Sunday  
- `1`  Monday  
- `2`  Tuesday  
- `3`  Wednesday  
- `4`  Thursday  
- `5`  Friday  
- `6`  Saturday

expiration_time.description: Defines the ending hour for the happy hours promotion in HH:mm format. Happy hours are *inactive after* this time.

VoucherAssets.title: Voucher Assets
VoucherAssets.description: Stores links to images of QR and barcode that correspond to an encrypted voucher code.

qr.description: Stores Quick Response (QR) representation of encrypted code.

id.description: Encrypted voucher code ID.

barcode.description: Stores barcode representation of encrypted code.

id.description: Encrypted voucher code ID.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about validation rules assignments.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of validation rules assignments.

data.description: Contains array of validation rules assignments.

total.description: Total number of validation rules assignments.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about validation rule assignments.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the JSON property that contains the array of validation rule assignments.

data.description: A dictionary that contains an array of validation rule assignments.

total.description: Total number of validation rule assignments.

4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN_.title: Discount Coupons
4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN_.description: These are parameters representing a discount coupon, which is a subset of a Campaign reward.

id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Campaign type.

4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN_.title: Gift Vouchers
4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN_.description: These are parameters representing a gift voucher, which is a subset of a Campaign reward.

id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign assigned by Voucherify.

balance.description: The incremental amout to be added to the current balance on the gift card. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

type.description: Campaign type.

4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN_.title: Points on loyalty card
4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN_.description: These are parameters representing points on a loyalty card, which is a subset of a Campaign reward.

id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign assigned by Voucherify.

balance.description: The incremental points to be added to the current balance on the loyalty card.

type.description: Campaign type.
The number of points to be added to the loyalty card.

points.description: Defines how the points are added to the loyalty card. FIXED adds a fixed number of points.

id.description: Unique identifier of the order line item.

sku_id.description: Unique identifier of the SKU. It is assigned by Voucherify.

product_id.description: Unique identifier of the product. It is assigned by Voucherify.

related_object.description: Used along with the source_id property, can be set to either sku or product.

source_id.description: The merchant's product/SKU ID (if it is different from the Voucherify product/SKU ID). It is useful in the integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce site, a database, or a third-party service.

quantity.description: The quantity of the particular item in the cart.

initial_quantity.description: A positive integer in the smallest unit quantity representing the total amount of the order; this is the sum of the order items' quantity.

amount.description: The total amount of the order item (price * quantity).

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-item-level discounts applied to the order.

applied_discount_amount.description: This field shows the order-level discount applied.

applied_discount_quantity.description: Number of the discounted items applied in the transaction.

applied_quantity.description: Quantity of items changed by the application of a new quantity items. It can be positive when an item is added or negative if an item is replaced.

applied_quantity_amount.description: Amount for the items changed by the application of a new quantity items. It can be positive when an item is added or negative if an item is replaced.

initial_amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

price.description: Unit price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtotal_amount.description:
Final order item amount after the applied item-level discount.  If there are no item-level discounts applied, this item is equal to the `amount`.   
`subtotal_amount`=`amount`-`applied_discount_amount`

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to an item object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the item in a structured format. It can be used to define business validation rules or discount formulas.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the redemption was created in ISO 8601 format.

rollback_id.description: Unique identifier of the redemption rollback.

rollback_date.description: Timestamp representing the date and tiem when the redemption rollback was created in the ISO 8601 format.

related_object_id.description: Unique identifier of the parent redemption.

related_object_parent_id.description: Represent's the campaign ID of the voucher if the redemption was based on a voucher that was part of bulk codes generated within a campaign. In case of a promotion tier, this represents the campaign ID of the promotion tier's parent campaign.

stacked.description: Contains a list of unique IDs of child redemptions, which belong to the stacked incentives.

rollback_stacked.description: Lists the rollback redemption IDs of the particular child redemptions.

EventSource.title: Event Source
EventSource.description: Contains the source of the object that initiated the event.

channel.description: Determines the channel that initiated the event.

user.description: Determines the Voucherify user who triggered the event.

id.description: Unique identifier of the user.

api_key.description: Determines the API key used to initiate the event.

name.description: Channel name in the application keys.

app_id.description: Contains the application ID from the Voucherify API key pair.

id.description: Unique product ID, assigned by Voucherify.
Unique SKU ID, assigned by Voucherify.

unit_off.description: Number of units granted a full value discount.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product inventory (e.g. time, items).

CodeConfig.title: Code Config
CodeConfig.description: Schema containing information about config used for voucher. Defines the code pattern (prefix, suffix, length, charset, etc).

length.description: Number of characters in a generated code (excluding prefix and postfix).

charset.description: Characters that can appear in the code.

prefix.description: A text appended before the code.

postfix.description: A text appended after the code.

pattern.description: A pattern for codes where hashes (#) will be replaced with random characters. Overrides `length`.

id.description: Unique product ID assigned by Voucherify.

price.description: Unit price. It is represented by a value multiplied by 100 to accurately reflect 2 decimal places, such as `$100.00` being expressed as `10000`.

attributes.description: A list of product attributes whose values you can customize for given SKUs: `["color","size","ranking"]`. Each child SKU can have a unique value for a given attribute.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the product. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a product object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the product in a structured format.

image_url.description: The HTTPS URL pointing to the .png or .jpg file that will be used to render the product image.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the product was created in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the product was updated in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the product.
The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about SKUs.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the JSON property that contains the array of SKUs.

data.description: A dictionary that contains an array of SKUs.

total.description: Total number of SKUs in the product.

BusValRuleAssignment.title: Business Validation Rule Assignment
BusValRuleAssignment.description: Assignments of a business validation rule

id.description: The unique identifier for an assignment.

rule_id.description: The unique identifier for a rule.

related_object_id.description: The unique identifier for a related object.

related_object_type.description: The type of a related object.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was last updated in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

validation_status.description: The validation status of the assignment.

ValidationRuleAssignment.title: Validation Rule Assignment
ValidationRuleAssignment.description: Object representing a validation rule assignment.

id.description: Validation rule assignment ID.

related_object_id.description: The resource ID to which the validation rule was assigned.

related_object_type.description: The type of resource to which the validation rule was assigned.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the validation rule assignment was created in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the ID.

type.description: Type of calculation.

multiplier.description: Multiplication factor used to multiply the points to obtain the mapped points.

type.description: Type of calculation.

points.description: Fixed number of points to be applied.

type.description: Defines how the points are added to the loyalty card. PROPORTIONAL adds points based on a pre-defined ratio.

calculation_type.description: CUSTOMER_METADATA: Customer Metadata (X points for every Y in metadata attribute, defined in the property key under the customer.metadata object).

metadata.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the `calculation_type` parameter.

every.description: For how many increments of the customer metadata property to grant points for.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

type.description: Defines how the points are added to the loyalty card. PROPORTIONAL adds points based on a pre-defined ratio.

calculation_type.description: `CUSTOM_EVENT_METADATA`: Custom event metadata (X points for every Y in metadata attribute).

metadata.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the `calculation_type` parameter.

every.description: For how many increments of the customer metadata property to grant points for.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

type.description: Defines how the points are added to the loyalty card. PROPORTIONAL adds points based on a pre-defined ratio.

calculation_type.description: `ORDER_ITEMS_QUANTITY`: Quantity of the items defined in order_items.quantity.object & .id (X points for every Y items excluding free items).

quantity.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the `calculation_type` parameter.

every.description: The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 order amount is written as 1000.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

object.description: Type of object taken under consideration.

id.description: unique identifier of the resource, i.e. pc_75U0dHlr7u75BJodrW1AE3t6, prod_0bae32322150fd0546, or sku_0b7d7dfb090be5c619.

type.description: Defines how the points are added to the loyalty card. `PROPORTIONAL` adds points based on a pre-defined ratio.

calculation_type.description: ORDER_ITEMS_AMOUNT; Pre-discount amount spent on items defined in the order_items.amount.object & .id (X points for every Y spent on items excluding discounts)

amount.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the `calculation_type` parameter.

every.description: The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 order amount is written as 1000.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

object.description: Type of object taken under consideration.

id.description: Unique identifier of the resource, i.e. pc_75U0dHlr7u75BJodrW1AE3t6, prod_0bae32322150fd0546, or sku_0b7d7dfb090be5c619.

type.description: Defines how the points are added to the loyalty card. PROPORTIONAL adds points based on a pre-defined ratio.

calculation_type.description: ORDER_ITEMS_SUBTOTAL_AMOUNT; Amount spent on items defined in the order_items.subtotal_amount.object & .id (X points for every Y spent on items including discounts)

subtotal_amount.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the `calculation_type` parameter.

every.description: The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 order amount is written as 1000.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

object.description: Type of object taken under consideration.

id.description: unique identifier of the resource, i.e. pc_75U0dHlr7u75BJodrW1AE3t6, prod_0bae32322150fd0546, or sku_0b7d7dfb090be5c619.

type.description: Defines how the points are added to the loyalty card. `PROPORTIONAL` adds points based on a pre-defined ratio.

calculation_type.description: `ORDER_AMOUNT`: Pre-discount order amount (X points for every Y spent excluding discounts).

amount.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the `calculation_type` parameter.

every.description: The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 order amount is written as 1000.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

type.description: Defines how the points are added to the loyalty card. PROPORTIONAL adds points based on a pre-defined ratio.

calculation_type.description: `ORDER_TOTAL_AMOUNT`: Total order amount (X points for every Y spent including discount)

total_amount.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the `calculation_type` parameter.

every.description: The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 order amount is written as 1000.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

type.description: Defines how the points are added to the loyalty card. PROPORTIONAL adds points based on a pre-defined ratio.

calculation_type.description: `ORDER_METADATA`: Order Metadata (X points for every Y in metadata attribute, defined in the property key under the order.metadata object)

order.description: Defines the formula for calculating points proportionally.

metadata.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the `calculation_type` parameter.

every.description: For how many increments of the order metadata property to grant points for.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.
